Pride Month Writing Challenge #4

Fandom: Marvel, Spiderman: Homecoming

Pairing: Peter Parker x Stark Trans Male Reader

Summary: You have been keeping a major secret from your boyfriend about who you are…

Warnings: male reader, he/him pronouns, angst, fluff, coming out, transgender content

Wordcount: 2150

A/N: Got this request for my pride month writing challenge: Peter Parker x Stark!male reader where our lovely spider has no idea that the Stark boy is trans until they end up hanging out one night and R takes off his shirt and he has scars from top surgery. This is the last pride month fic, and it has been amazing to write these stories for you guys. In conclusion, trans people are beautiful and I hope that I didn’t slaughter this. ❤️ Jerod

The first time you saw Peter Parker was in your dad’s lab. He was busy tinkering away at something, all of his concentration thrown into his work. You immediately thought he was cute. The way his eyebrows knitted together and his tongue slightly stuck out between his lips. You pushed that to the back of your mind, however, when you realized that said cute boy is a complete stranger and is in your father’s lab. “Who the hell are you!? And what do you think you’re doing in here?” The brown-haired boy jumps, almost sending whatever tool he had in his hand flying through the air. His eyes dart around for a few moments, obviously unaware of where you are in the room. When he finds you, however, his eyes lock onto yours and he visibly gulps.

“I-I’m P-Peter,” he sputters out. You raise your eyebrows and nod your head, signaling for him to continue his explanation. Instead, he just opens and closes his mouth a few times without getting a word out.

“Alright, ‘Peter,’” you emphasize his alleged name with air quotes, “I’m calling security.” At that, he jumps from his stool and quickly shuffles over to you. You back away from him cautiously. If this kid can get into a high-security facility, who knows what else he’s capable of.

“W-wait, please. I-I’m a personal assistant to-to Mr. Stark.” You had never even seen this boy before, let alone met him! How could he possibly be a “personal assistant” to your father.

“Yyyeeeaaahhh…okay. Come any closer to me and you’ll regret it.” Your father had made you your own version of an Iron Man suit. With the latest nanite tech, it’s able to be deployed from your watch. You shuffle threw a few options on said piece of jewelry before finding the one you need and call every security officer nearby to your position. Before any of them can get there, however, your father flies in through the roof hatch, landing on the pad beneath it. His helmet de-materializes, revealing his worried face.

“(Y/N), what’s wrong?” he questions urgently. You point to the boy standing in front of you, his head now hung low. You side-step around him and make your way closer to your father.

“Dad!” you say somewhat stupefied.

“Dad!?” the other boy blurts out, obviously surprised. You shoot a deadly glare his way before turning your attention back to your father.

“There’s an intruder in your own lab, and you’re asking what’s wrong!?” Your father looks between you and the other boy before bursting out into laughter. “Why is this funny to you!?”

“M-Mr. Stark, I’m sorry. I tried telling him I’m your personal assistant, but he didn’t believe me, and…” the other boy is cut off by your dad raising his hand. He takes a few breaths, collecting himself after his outburst.

“(Y/N), meet Peter Parker. Peter, meet my son (Y/N).”

You felt bad for almost having Peter arrested and offered to let you make it up to him by taking him out for lunch and a movie. He reluctantly accepted and the two of you had so much fun that you almost instantly became best friends. A few months later, you confessed you had feelings for each other and started dating.

You tell Peter everything…well, everything except for the fact you were not born a male. You were born as Hope Stark, a girl. You told your father that you were actually a boy when you were fourteen. He took it so well, saying that if you were sure you were born the wrong gender, he would help you with your transition. You had had top surgery about six months before you met Peter. Your father recently came up with a compound that will almost completely erase your scars, but it’s still in the final testing phase and he has forbidden you from using it until he’s 100% sure it’s okay.

Because of your oh-so-obvious scars, you refuse to take off your shirt around Peter. The only way that that could end is with the very conversation you want to avoid. You know that if you’re going to be with him long-term, you’ll have to tell him eventually, but you don’t think you can risk the possibility that he’d reject you. The very idea of losing Peter makes your insides feel like they are being wrung out.

Today is Saturday, and since the whole Spider-Man business has been slow lately and your father doesn’t need his help, you get to spend the entire day with your amazing boyfriend. The two of you are walking through Central Park, fingers laced together and arms swinging back and forth like little kids. Peter holds a milkshake in his other hand, bringing the straw to his lips for a drink every now and again before offering it to you for a sip. The air is starting to get cooler, signaling the oncoming autumn. You glance down at your sweatshirt, one of Peter’s comfy blue Midtown ones, and feel your cheeks heat up again from wearing your boyfriend’s clothes. The intimacy of it all still has you reeling.

“Petey…” you begin. He makes a “hmm” noise around the straw, indicating that he’s paying attention. You gently pull him to a stop and encircle his torso with your arms. He moves the cup away from his face and you take the opportunity to nuzzle into the crook of his neck. “Today has been absolutely amazing. Thank you so much.” Peter chuckles lightly, wrapping his arms around your back.

“I had a really great time today too,” he mumbles into your hair. “Listen…(Y/N)…there’s something I’ve been wanting to tell you for a while now, and…it’s just…I don’t know, now feels like a good time…” You lift your head to look him in the eyes, ready to hear whatever he has to say when you feel something wet hit your nose. You look up at the sky, suddenly dark and overcast. As if on cue, thunder rumbles in the distance and rain starts to cascade down from the sky.

“Shit, we don’t have an umbrella,” you squeak out. Peter looks around quickly, grabbing your hand and leading you to a nearby pagoda. The rain intensifies, turning into more of a torrential downpour. “If I had my watch, I could just activate my suit and fly us to the tower. You don’t have any of your gear, do you?” Peter shakes his head ‘no,’ which makes you groan out a defeated sigh. “Alright, the tower isn’t too far away. We can just make a run for it.” You look at him for confirmation and, with one last look at the sheets of water coming down, Peter reluctantly agrees.

Despite your best efforts, by the time you make it through the back entrance of the tower, you’re both soaked from head to toe. The two of you take the elevator up to the penthouse, which is still filled with boxes and crates of stuff that have to be moved upstate. “My dad made sure to have me leave some emergency clothes and stuff like that here, just in case.” You enter your old room, making your way over to the large connected closet; the small amount of clothes left seem comical in such a large space. You pick out some new clothes for yourself and throw some to Peter as well as a towel to dry off with. Neither of you had seen each other naked yet and, due to your scars, you suggest Peter change in your room while you stay in the closet to do so. He obliges your wish and leaves without saying a word.

You take your time pulling off the damp clothes, reveling in the feeling of them no longer sticking to your skin. You dry off and slip into a fresh, dry pair of underwear and pants. You pick up the shirt you selected, ready to pull it on over your head, when your feel hands rest at your waist. You yelp out of surprise and spin around, almost falling over in the process. Peter’s laugh, which you usually find so melodic and beautiful, now makes you blood boil. Said laughter is soon cut short, however, when he glances down at your chest. Now realizing how exposed you are, you quickly fumble to cover up your torso with the shirt. Peter’s eyebrows knit together and his head cocks to the side slightly.

“(Y/N)…what happened?” You can hear the slight worry laced in his voice.

“What? N-nothing! W-why…why would you think something happened!?” The explicit panic in your voice doesn’t go unnoticed.

“Because you have scars on your chest.” He moves closer to you, reaching out to try and grab the shirt. You recede from him, your bare back meeting the cold wall. You almost regret the move, however, from the hurt look plastered on Peter’s face.

“No! No, this isn’t how I wanted you to find out!” You yell more towards yourself than the other boy. He reaches out again, and while you tense up, you relax at the felling of his hand lightly gripping your shoulder.

“Find out what, baby? Come on, you’re scaring me!” The amount of desperation that rings through tugs at your heartstrings. A million thoughts begin to race through your mind. Should you tell him the truth? Should you try to find a way to weasel out of the conversation? Should you break things off with Peter before he has the chance to?

Drawing out a sigh, you slowly lower the shirt, revealing your torso and the scars about an inch below your nipples. Peter’s eyes are fixated on them, causing you to retreat in on yourself out of self-consciousness. He trails his hand down your shoulder, looking into your eyes for permission before ghosting his fingertips over top the raised flesh. You feel tears start to prick at your eyes as he continues to concentrate on them. You try, and fail, to stifle a sob, which makes Peter’s eyes snap back up to yours. His deep brown doe-eyes still swim with concern, the sight making you tear up even more.

Your crying escalates to light sobbing, which Peter takes as his cue to pull you into his chest, holding you in his way-too-strong-for-his-size arms. The two of you slowly sink down to the carpeted floor, him helping you the way down. “I-I’m sorry,” you choke out. He tightens his grip on you, one of his hands tangling itself in your hair.

“You have nothing to be sorry about,” his tender tone only exacerbates your sobbing. For the next few minutes, Peter just holds you while you cry. Neither of you make an attempt to move and the only noises are your sobs and Peter’s quiet whispers of sweet nothings. After your crying calms down to mild sniffles, Peter pulls away from you and immediately places his hands on either side of your face. He wipes away the leftover tears with his thumbs and cracks his gorgeous smile when you finally meet his eyes.

“There’s my beautiful boy…” he whispers.

“Peter…I’m not…I mean…I wasn’t born…” Peter places a finger on your lips, shaking his head from side to side.

“(Y/N), I don’t care what you were ‘born as.’ You’re you and you’re the amazing, wonderful, gorgeous boy that I…the boy that I f-fell in love with.” Your eyes widen as the last few words leave his mouth. “God…I just…” He looks down for a moment before gazing back into your eyes. He cups your face with his hands again, an act which you absolutely love, and gingerly places his lips against yours. You wrap your arms around his neck, deepening the kiss. Before you can properly make out, however, he pulls away from you. He rests his forehead against yours and breathes in a shaky breath. “(Y/N)…I-I’ve been wanting to tell you that, for a while now.”

You caress his left cheek before pulling away from him, gazing into his gorgeous eyes again. “Peter…I-I’m also…in love with you.” He smiles, exposing his pearly white teeth. “Wait, is that what you wanted to tell me back in Central Park?” You suddenly remembered your conversation from before that the rain so rudely interrupted. He looks down, capturing your hand in his and holding it. He finally raises his head back up, meeting your eyes again and nodding sheepishly.

You can’t help the smile that breaks out across your face as you wrap your arms around his shoulders, pulling him into yourself. An unexplainable warmth radiates throughout your body as he reciprocates the embrace, holding you just as tightly as you’re holding onto him. You get the distinct feeling that this is just the beginning for the love story of (Y/N) Stark and Peter Parker. Who knows where that story will take you?

“Yyyeeeaaahhh…okay. Come any closer to me and you’ll regret it.” Your father had made you your own version of an Iron Man suit. With the latest nanite tech, it’s able to be deployed from your watch. You shuffle threw a few options on said piece of jewelry before finding the one you need and call every security officer nearby to your position. Before any of them can get there, however, your father flies in through the roof hatch, landing on the pad beneath it. His helmet de-materializes, revealing his worried face.

“(Y/N), what’s wrong?” he questions urgently. You point to the boy standing in front of you, his head now hung low. You side-step around him and make your way closer to your father.

“Dad!” you say somewhat stupefied.

“Dad!?” the other boy blurts out, obviously surprised. You shoot a deadly glare his way before turning your attention back to your father.

“There’s an intruder in your own lab, and you’re asking what’s wrong!?” Your father looks between you and the other boy before bursting out into laughter. “Why is this funny to you!?”

“M-Mr. Stark, I’m sorry. I tried telling him I’m your personal assistant, but he didn’t believe me, and…” the other boy is cut off by your dad raising his hand. He takes a few breaths, collecting himself after his outburst.

“(Y/N), meet Peter Parker. Peter, meet my son (Y/N).”

You felt bad for almost having Peter arrested and offered to let you make it up to him by taking him out for lunch and a movie. He reluctantly accepted and the two of you had so much fun that you almost instantly became best friends. A few months later, you confessed you had feelings for each other and started dating.

You tell Peter everything…well, everything except for the fact you were not born a male. You were born as Hope Stark, a girl. You told your father that you were actually a boy when you were fourteen. He took it so well, saying that if you were sure you were born the wrong gender, he would help you with your transition. You had had top surgery about six months before you met Peter. Your father recently came up with a compound that will almost completely erase your scars, but it’s still in the final testing phase and he has forbidden you from using it until he’s 100% sure it’s okay.

Because of your oh-so-obvious scars, you refuse to take off your shirt around Peter. The only way that that could end is with the very conversation you want to avoid. You know that if you’re going to be with him long-term, you’ll have to tell him eventually, but you don’t think you can risk the possibility that he’d reject you. The very idea of losing Peter makes your insides feel like they are being wrung out.

Today is Saturday, and since the whole Spider-Man business has been slow lately and your father doesn’t need his help, you get to spend the entire day with your amazing boyfriend. The two of you are walking through Central Park, fingers laced together and arms swinging back and forth like little kids. Peter holds a milkshake in his other hand, bringing the straw to his lips for a drink every now and again before offering it to you for a sip. The air is starting to get cooler, signaling the oncoming autumn. You glance down at your sweatshirt, one of Peter’s comfy blue Midtown ones, and feel your cheeks heat up again from wearing your boyfriend’s clothes. The intimacy of it all still has you reeling.

“Petey…” you begin. He makes a “hmm” noise around the straw, indicating that he’s paying attention. You gently pull him to a stop and encircle his torso with your arms. He moves the cup away from his face and you take the opportunity to nuzzle into the crook of his neck. “Today has been absolutely amazing. Thank you so much.” Peter chuckles lightly, wrapping his arms around your back.

“I had a really great time today too,” he mumbles into your hair. “Listen…(Y/N)…there’s something I’ve been wanting to tell you for a while now, and…it’s just…I don’t know, now feels like a good time…” You lift your head to look him in the eyes, ready to hear whatever he has to say when you feel something wet hit your nose. You look up at the sky, suddenly dark and overcast. As if on cue, thunder rumbles in the distance and rain starts to cascade down from the sky.

“Shit, we don’t have an umbrella,” you squeak out. Peter looks around quickly, grabbing your hand and leading you to a nearby pagoda. The rain intensifies, turning into more of a torrential downpour. “If I had my watch, I could just activate my suit and fly us to the tower. You don’t have any of your gear, do you?” Peter shakes his head ‘no,’ which makes you groan out a defeated sigh. “Alright, the tower isn’t too far away. We can just make a run for it.” You look at him for confirmation and, with one last look at the sheets of water coming down, Peter reluctantly agrees.

Despite your best efforts, by the time you make it through the back entrance of the tower, you’re both soaked from head to toe. The two of you take the elevator up to the penthouse, which is still filled with boxes and crates of stuff that have to be moved upstate. “My dad made sure to have me leave some emergency clothes and stuff like that here, just in case.” You enter your old room, making your way over to the large connected closet; the small amount of clothes left seem comical in such a large space. You pick out some new clothes for yourself and throw some to Peter as well as a towel to dry off with. Neither of you had seen each other naked yet and, due to your scars, you suggest Peter change in your room while you stay in the closet to do so. He obliges your wish and leaves without saying a word.

You take your time pulling off the damp clothes, reveling in the feeling of them no longer sticking to your skin. You dry off and slip into a fresh, dry pair of underwear and pants. You pick up the shirt you selected, ready to pull it on over your head, when your feel hands rest at your waist. You yelp out of surprise and spin around, almost falling over in the process. Peter’s laugh, which you usually find so melodic and beautiful, now makes you blood boil. Said laughter is soon cut short, however, when he glances down at your chest. Now realizing how exposed you are, you quickly fumble to cover up your torso with the shirt. Peter’s eyebrows knit together and his head cocks to the side slightly.

“(Y/N)…what happened?” You can hear the slight worry laced in his voice.

“What? N-nothing! W-why…why would you think something happened!?” The explicit panic in your voice doesn’t go unnoticed.

“Because you have scars on your chest.” He moves closer to you, reaching out to try and grab the shirt. You recede from him, your bare back meeting the cold wall. You almost regret the move, however, from the hurt look plastered on Peter’s face.

“No! No, this isn’t how I wanted you to find out!” You yell more towards yourself than the other boy. He reaches out again, and while you tense up, you relax at the felling of his hand lightly gripping your shoulder.

“Find out what, baby? Come on, you’re scaring me!” The amount of desperation that rings through tugs at your heartstrings. A million thoughts begin to race through your mind. Should you tell him the truth? Should you try to find a way to weasel out of the conversation? Should you break things off with Peter before he has the chance to?

Drawing out a sigh, you slowly lower the shirt, revealing your torso and the scars about an inch below your nipples. Peter’s eyes are fixated on them, causing you to retreat in on yourself out of self-consciousness. He trails his hand down your shoulder, looking into your eyes for permission before ghosting his fingertips over top the raised flesh. You feel tears start to prick at your eyes as he continues to concentrate on them. You try, and fail, to stifle a sob, which makes Peter’s eyes snap back up to yours. His deep brown doe-eyes still swim with concern, the sight making you tear up even more.

Your crying escalates to light sobbing, which Peter takes as his cue to pull you into his chest, holding you in his way-too-strong-for-his-size arms. The two of you slowly sink down to the carpeted floor, him helping you the way down. “I-I’m sorry,” you choke out. He tightens his grip on you, one of his hands tangling itself in your hair.

“You have nothing to be sorry about,” his tender tone only exacerbates your sobbing. For the next few minutes, Peter just holds you while you cry. Neither of you make an attempt to move and the only noises are your sobs and Peter’s quiet whispers of sweet nothings. After your crying calms down to mild sniffles, Peter pulls away from you and immediately places his hands on either side of your face. He wipes away the leftover tears with his thumbs and cracks his gorgeous smile when you finally meet his eyes.

“There’s my beautiful boy…” he whispers.

“Peter…I’m not…I mean…I wasn’t born…” Peter places a finger on your lips, shaking his head from side to side.

“(Y/N), I don’t care what you were ‘born as.’ You’re you and you’re the amazing, wonderful, gorgeous boy that I…the boy that I f-fell in love with.” Your eyes widen as the last few words leave his mouth. “God…I just…” He looks down for a moment before gazing back into your eyes. He cups your face with his hands again, an act which you absolutely love, and gingerly places his lips against yours. You wrap your arms around his neck, deepening the kiss. Before you can properly make out, however, he pulls away from you. He rests his forehead against yours and breathes in a shaky breath. “(Y/N)…I-I’ve been wanting to tell you that, for a while now.”

You caress his left cheek before pulling away from him, gazing into his gorgeous eyes again. “Peter…I-I’m also…in love with you.” He smiles, exposing his pearly white teeth. “Wait, is that what you wanted to tell me back in Central Park?” You suddenly remembered your conversation from before that the rain so rudely interrupted. He looks down, capturing your hand in his and holding it. He finally raises his head back up, meeting your eyes again and nodding sheepishly.

You can’t help the smile that breaks out across your face as you wrap your arms around his shoulders, pulling him into yourself. An unexplainable warmth radiates throughout your body as he reciprocates the embrace, holding you just as tightly as you’re holding onto him. You get the distinct feeling that this is just the beginning for the love story of (Y/N) Stark and Peter Parker. Who knows where that story will take you?

A/N: Thanks again to all of you for your requests for this writing challenge. I love all of you and everyone reading this. Feel free to dm or ask me anything.

summary:
peter parker dating a swimmer would include.. 
a/n: i’m s swimmer and i love the concept of peter dating an am ugh cutie 
words:...
body:
peter parker dating a swimmer would include..

a/n: i’m s swimmer and i love the concept of peter dating an am ugh cutie

words: 2.5k. just a baby gc that i whopped up cuz idk it’s cute

warnings: fluffy and bad writing ye

being a swimmer and dating peter would include

• lots of jokes about you being princess ariel from the little mermaid

• even though it was a swimming pool and not the ocean

• “are there any undersea creatures spider-man should know about”

• “i mean, unless you count the pool cleaner.”

• “why? is he a mermaid?”

• “……yes, lets go with that, babe.”

• he’d be so supportive over u and being on the swim team

• peter thinks it’s so cool and interesting to be with someone who’s also athletic

• you know he’d love you no matter what, but you being an athlete, especially a swimmer, really was something he found cute and very interesting about you

• “can i go to one of your meets?” he’d ask you, those chocolate brown eyes looking so promising and loving

• “pete…i dunno, they’re kind of boring.”

• “nothing that has you is boring, not ever.”

• you were a bit hesitant, not because you didn’t want peter to come, but a swimsuit for this stuff in particular wasn’t exactly. flattering. or cute.

• but because of his sweetness and wanting to be a supportive boyfriend, you said he can come

• after the first meet, becaus ehe was so proud and so in awe, he went to every single swim meet and practice followed by

• after every practice, which ended late most of the time

• peter would come by to walk you home and bring you a warm towel that he put in the dryer for a few seconds and bring you some snacks and some water

• “hey, you!” hes greet you and wrap you up in a towel and give you a billion little nose pecks

• peter had no shame for being literally soaked after due to you just getting out of the pool

• everyone thought it was adorable, even your coaches

• he always there to give you warm hugs and wrap you up tight

• massages. so so many massages.

• swimmers get a lot of shoulder pans and back pains due to the amount of muscles they use for every stroke

• and without a doubt, peter was right there to help with with every little shoulder or back pain you had

• his massages were so heavenly


• peter was the most supportive boyfriend EVER and he wanted to be there for every little thing you did. he wanted you to know he was your biggest fan for everything and this was just a lil thing he was proud of

• he would go to the meet with ur parents!! how sweet!!

• he’d sit w them sweetly the whole time and ask a bunch of questions but like also be watching you do ur thing and be in awe

• swimming is a hard sport, but peter had no idea it was this hard

• he made sure he had water and snacks on hand at all times, athletes need their energy and his baby bug needed energy

• when it wasn’t your race to swim, you’d sit with your friends and would invite peter to join

• poor baby was really shy at first, being around your friends

• he wanted to seem like a good person and a supportive boyfriend

• but little did he know, he was showing it by just simply being there

• your friends adored him

• not more than you, of course

• you made sure that you included him in every conversation and asked for his opinions so he felt comfortable

• and peter definitely appreciated that. you were such sweetheart to him.

• oh. my god. when it came to the actual swimming part peter was your biggest FAN.

• since he would come to ever single meet, even the ones that were away, he would make you a new sign and hold it up loud n’ proud.

• lotta people in the crowd felt annoyed and even told him to relax with the cheering and holding up the sign

• but he didn’t really care, he wanted you to have all the courage in the word

• and he wanted you to know he was with you every step of the way

• sometimes before an event, you’d get nervous

• so, peter has this little routine with you

• he would hold both of your hands and would make the two of you jump up and down for a few seconds

• just to get all the jitters out of you

• and no matter what, peter always said he loved you before every single race

• after you would get out of the pool peter would have your warm towel waiting for you at the finish line

• and hugs, so many warm hugs

• and a few little kisses on ur bare shoulder, because he was a sucker for the little freckles sprinkled across like baby stars or little flower petals

• sometimes you’d get overwhelmed or disappear and would start crying after a race

• peter was there to hug you for as long as you needed and let you know how amazing you did

• “i-i got fourth, i did awful.” you’d sob into his chest, peter quietly shushing you as he rubs your back sweetly

• “hey, hey, you’ll get em’ next time. it’s growth, baby; all about growth.”

• peter always reminds you that it wasn’t just about the winning, it’s all about the growth and getting better as an athlete and a human being.

• he told you that his uncle ben used to say that, and he would never not believe it.

• peter would never not believe in you

• you were his star

~

taglist: @plushparker @parkers-fidelity @zipitparker @cutesparker @naturallytom @dorkpeter @mcuspidey @spideypeach @peterparkersbodyguard

• peter was the most supportive boyfriend EVER and he wanted to be there for every little thing you did. he wanted you to know he was your biggest fan for everything and this was just a lil thing he was proud of

• he would go to the meet with ur parents!! how sweet!!

• he’d sit w them sweetly the whole time and ask a bunch of questions but like also be watching you do ur thing and be in awe

• swimming is a hard sport, but peter had no idea it was this hard

• he made sure he had water and snacks on hand at all times, athletes need their energy and his baby bug needed energy

• when it wasn’t your race to swim, you’d sit with your friends and would invite peter to join

• poor baby was really shy at first, being around your friends

• he wanted to seem like a good person and a supportive boyfriend

• but little did he know, he was showing it by just simply being there

• your friends adored him

• not more than you, of course

• you made sure that you included him in every conversation and asked for his opinions so he felt comfortable

• and peter definitely appreciated that. you were such sweetheart to him.

• oh. my god. when it came to the actual swimming part peter was your biggest FAN.

• since he would come to ever single meet, even the ones that were away, he would make you a new sign and hold it up loud n’ proud.

• lotta people in the crowd felt annoyed and even told him to relax with the cheering and holding up the sign

• but he didn’t really care, he wanted you to have all the courage in the word

• and he wanted you to know he was with you every step of the way

• sometimes before an event, you’d get nervous

• so, peter has this little routine with you

• he would hold both of your hands and would make the two of you jump up and down for a few seconds

• just to get all the jitters out of you

• and no matter what, peter always said he loved you before every single race

• after you would get out of the pool peter would have your warm towel waiting for you at the finish line

• and hugs, so many warm hugs

• and a few little kisses on ur bare shoulder, because he was a sucker for the little freckles sprinkled across like baby stars or little flower petals

• sometimes you’d get overwhelmed or disappear and would start crying after a race

• peter was there to hug you for as long as you needed and let you know how amazing you did

• “i-i got fourth, i did awful.” you’d sob into his chest, peter quietly shushing you as he rubs your back sweetly

• “hey, hey, you’ll get em’ next time. it’s growth, baby; all about growth.”

• peter always reminds you that it wasn’t just about the winning, it’s all about the growth and getting better as an athlete and a human being.

• he told you that his uncle ben used to say that, and he would never not believe it.

• peter would never not believe in you

• you were his star

~

taglist: @plushparker @parkers-fidelity @zipitparker @cutesparker @naturallytom @dorkpeter @mcuspidey @spideypeach @peterparkersbodyguard

title: at the end of the day (chapter six)
body:
summary:  there are two gigantic mysteries in your life and one of them includes peter parker not seeming to like you. you can him not being your friend but being in the same friend group? that should be easy, right?

a/n: sOOO i don’t know why this took me forever to write but also…i hope you guys enjoy! also, i’m sorry there are probably a million typos in here.

warnings: some angst and probably a lot of typos.

masterlist / taglist / series masterlist 

In a few days, your ‘Introduction to Engineering’ class was going to Stark Tower to learn more about career paths in engineering. MJ, unfortunately, wasn’t in this class with you and you didn’t enjoy that you would have to leave your best friend alone in school. This was one class you shared with Peter and Ned and didn’t know what to expect, considering your weird encounter with Peter.

When you walked into class, he nodded in your direction and you gave him a petite wave. Ned gestured for you to sit at the combined table with him and sat in front of the two teenagers as everyone shuffled in.

“I can’t believe we’re going to Stark Tower,” Ned said out of excitement. “That’s so cool!”

“It’s not as cool as you think it is,” Peter said casually. “It’s more businessmen and businesswomen more than Avengers, honestly.”

“How do you know that?” you asked Peter.

His eyes widened. “Oh, uh, my internship! Yeah, I intern for Stark Industries and I’ve met the Avengers a couple of times.”

“That’s pretty cool,” you said with a gentle smile. “Tony seems like a nice person.”

“The nicest,” Peter said with a knowing grin.

You thought about how the field trip would be absolutely redundant considering you had just gotten an extensive tour from Steve Rogers himself, but you were excited to learn more about career paths in an environment you wanted to work in.

“Okay, class!” Your teacher announced. “Release forms and liability papers are being passed around. It’s important you get this to me by Thursday the latest if you want to go on this field trip. For the rest of the class period, you can treat this as a study hall.”

You emitted a sigh and you were internally grateful for this chance to catch up on homework. Due to your late night rendezvous with Spider-Man and your many trips to Stark Tower, you ended up staying up until two in the morning finishing homework for the next school day.

“Do you think we’ll see any Avengers?” Ned asked.

“Probably,” said Peter.

“Now that’s cool,” Ned replied. “I can’t believe I’m going to meet an Avenger.”

You missed this interaction, but Peter gave him a feigned annoyed expression and Ned chuckled at the fact that he had disregarded his best friend being Spider-Man.

“I hope Spidey’s there,” you said casually as you punched numbers into your calculator.

“Who?” asked Peter.

“Oh, Spider-Man,” you said, kicking yourself for using your nickname for him. “I hope he’s at the tower. I’d, uh, I’d really like to meet him.”

“You really like Spider-Man, huh?” Ned asked politely.

“You could say that,” you said with a sheepish grin. “He works under the radar and isn’t in it for the fame. He’s just really wholesome and pure, you know? Spider-Man cares for Queens and I couldn’t ask someone better to look up to.”

Peter’s heart was racing despite taking the relaxing pill Tony had given him and he knew it was because of the feelings for you he was trying to surpress. His heart, at that moment, wasn’t beating fast because of his spidey senses but rather it was because he has internally admitted to himself that he liked you in a way he never thought possible.

He liked that you loved computer science and engineering. He liked that you were studious and wanted to get into a good college. He liked that you were mature for your age and had refrained from befriending Flash, despite Peter giving you ever reason to like him more. Most of all, Peter liked that you liked Spider-Man because that meant you liked him.

The only thing that made him nervous about liking you was not knowing how you’d react to him being Spider-Man. He didn’t know if you liked his alter ego for the fame that came with it or because you got to see a side of him no one else saw. Ned knew he was Spider-Man, sure, but Peter confided in you in a way he couldn’t with Ned.

Peter was nervous and he was sure that things would work out in the end because if he learned anything from getting to know you, it was that you were understanding and patient. Worst of all, you both admitted to liking one another on your balcony a few nights prior. The tension was building up and Peter was the one who lifted his mask to his nose and press his lips against yours, and you weren’t complaining.

Peter decided that for now, he wouldn’t say anything.

When you arrived home, you pulled out the release form and wanted your mother to sign it before you forgot it on your bedroom desk and didn’t want to turn it in too late.

“Hey, mom?” you said as you entered her workspace. She didn’t work from home every often but had a small office space that she used if she ever decided to bring her work home from her main office.

“What is it, sweet pea?” she asked with a gentle tone before taking her glasses off and turning to you in the chair she sat in.

“Mr. Harrington’s taking us to Stark Tower and needs this permission slip signed by Thursday but I was hoping to get it in tomorrow. Can you sign it for me?”

Your mother didn’t miss a heartbeat.

“Absolutely not,” she said. “I don’t want you anywhere near or inside of that tower.”

You groaned. “Well, why not? You know how much I want to work in the computer science field and this is an opportunity for me to learn more about a future career path.”

“Y/N,” she said, standing up from her seat, “I know this would be good for you but I don’t feel like Stark Tower is the safest place for you to be.”

“What are you talking about? There will be so many Avengers in that tower and people who can fight for a living. I’m sixteen and I’m about to start my life really soon and this could be a good way to learn about what I can do for the world.”

Your mother sighed and gave you a small smile, remembering all the moments you two shared as you grew up. She remembered the first time you touched a computer and decided that, while she didn’t like the idea of going to the tower, there wasn’t stopping you if it was to help your future.

“I just want you to know I’m advising you against this, but I’ll sign it for you,” she caved.

“Yes, yes, yes!” you exclaimed as you sat the paper down flat on her desk. You mother heaved a sigh and wrote her signature on a clean line at the bottom before handing the slip back to you.

“I want you to be extra careful when you’re there,” she said with a worried tone. You furrowed your eyebrows because when your mother got anxious, her tell was tapping her finger on a flat surface and her voice became an octave lower. This was one of those times.

“I will, mom. I promise.”

“I mean it,” she said. “Of all the times I’ve taught you life lessons and scolded you to be aware of your surroundings, I really mean it this time. There are some things you don’t know about that could seriously hurt you.” You gave your mother a reassuring hug.

“I know, mom. There’s so much I don’t know about but I want to learn about them. I’ll be careful, I promise.”

She gave you a smile and let you to your bedroom to finish your homework, not knowing what she let you get into.

***

Before you had arrived to school on the day of the field trip, Peter was rocking back and forth between his legs and trying to stay still when Ned put a hand on his shoulder.

“Dude, are you okay?” he asked.

Peter shook his head. “No. I don’t know know why my senses are going off the charts but I can’t seem to slow my heart rate down. The pills Mr. Stark gave me aren’t working and I can’t take another one unless I want to go into cardiac arrest.”

“Oh, man,” Ned replied. “What about that hunch you had with Y/N?”

“See, I thought that getting her go open up to me would solve it. She seemed pretty upset about her father and I thought that was the secret she had been keeping but it seems like there’s something else going on with her.”

“Like what?”

“Beats me,” said Peter. “Here she comes.”

“Hey Ned,” you said. “Peter.”

“You’re chirpy for seven-thirty,” Ned snorted. “I could barely get myself out of bed.”

“You look pretty excited, Peter,” you said with a stifled laugh. You had accredited to his antsy-self as excitement but didn’t know he was more nervous than excited.

“Yeah!” said Peter, playing along. “I can’t wait to see the tower when I’m not working. That’ll be fun.”

“I bet! I’m gonna head onto the bus,” you said before walking into the yellow bus.

“Go sit next to her. See if you can calm yourself down or find something that’ll help you,” Ned told you.

“Good idea,” Peter replied. He wasn’t exactly rejecting the idea of being right next to you. He saw you look mildly annoyed at your small shoulder bag when he approached. “Is anyone sitting here?”

“Oh! Um, no one’s sitting here,” you said, half paying attention. “Dang it.”

“You okay?” Peter asked as he took a seat.

“Yeah, I think I left my headphones on my desk at home,” you explained while shrugging. “This next forty-five minutes is gonna go by so slowly.”

“I left mine at home too,” Peter lied, knowing he had left them in the Avenger common room yesterday. “I guess we’re both unlucky today.

You laughed. “I guess so, Peter Parker.”

“Have any fun last weekend?”

“Hm?”

“With your friend,” Peter said, clearing his throat. “You mentioned you were seeing a friend.”

“Oh yeah. I did, didn’t I?” Peter nodded. “It was really fun, actually. He took me to this sandwich shop he likes and I are some pretty good food. I’m sorry, you probably not want to hear that,” you said, laughing as you shook your head.

“You can tell me,” Peter said with a genuine smile. “I like it when you’re happy.”

His statement, bold as ever, shocked you but you were determined to not show how shocked you were to avoid embarrassing yourself.

“That’s actually really sweet of you to say, Peter. Well, we don’t really do much other than hang out,” you said, leaving out the part where he often meets you and Tony Stark in the tower you were headed to. “He’s real nice. Gentle, even. That’s not weird, is it?”

“Definitely not,” he said quickly. “It’s, uh, it’s nice that you’ve found someone.”

You paused. “You’re being friendly.”

“What do you mean?”

“I mean, three weeks ago you practically ignoring me and now you’re asking about my love life.”

Peter laughed nervously. “Ned helped shed some light on how I had been acting. I-I was a shit person to you and I’m really sorry. I was going through some personal things in my life and couldn’t handle another person knowing about it.”

“That’s not an excuse, Peter.”

“I know,” he said. “I’m really sorry.”

You nodded once and decided that you’d let go of all animosity towards Peter and how you felt about him beforehand. The pent up emotions were let go as soon as you and Spider-Man had admitted feelings for one another and somehow, being around Peter reminded you of the masked hero. With that in mind, you decided that you’d focus your energy and attention on anything but hating Peter Parker.

The rest of the ride was quite pleasant and you accredited that to letting your wall against Peter crumble down the minute you had felt completely comfortable being around him. It was weird — you know that there was no reason for you to trust him and yet you sat there feeling like you had known Peter, really know him. His ‘energy’ was familiar and it wasn’t because you occasionally sat next to him during lunchtime. It wasn’t because you hung out with him once with Ned. This was something else entirely and you weren’t quite sure what it was.

When you arrived at Stark Tower, Mr. Harrington stood in front of the bus and urged everyone to be on their best behavior. You represented Midtown Tech, he reminded. Any of you could be working there in the future.

You filed out behind Ned and in front of Peter, who let you walk out the doors first. You looked at the familiar entrance and saw the usual bustling lobby you had grown accustomed to and the usual businessmen and businesswomen running late for meetings.

The tour guide met your group by the front doors and ‘debriefed’ the lot about procedures, rules, and what to do if there’s an emergency that needed to be handled.

“Welcome to my building,” Tony greeted. His eyes scanned over the crowd and was pleasantly surprised to see both your face and Peter’s. “I hope it’s everything you expected and more.”

A chorus of applause and happy murmurs were audible as Tony had granted access to a low level access laboratory that showcased what goes on in Stark Industry laboratories. The students milled around and looked at the people in white lab coats work on different projects (that were safe to be around, assured by Tony himself) and inspected daily work in the work space. Tony grinned at you when you caught his eye and saw that Natasha had snuck up to stand beside him. She gave you a wink and you gave her a shy wave before joining the rest of your class for the remaining portion of the tour.

“This is so neat,” Ned whisper-yelled. “I can’t believe you see this stuff every day.”

“Not every day,” Peter retorted. “But, pretty much.”

Peter was itching to talk to Tony about the predicament he found himself in. His heart was beating much faster than when he was outside of the building but now it was spiking like there was no tomorrow.

He walked passed the students while trying to be discreet about needed to see Tony to talk to him about his senses and why they were going haywire more than usual. Yeah, Peter could sense if there was someone running behind him or when Ned was trying to sneak up on him, but this wasn’t something he couldn’t understand.

“Mr. Stark, I-”

“Not now, kid,” Tony said quietly. “Come back after school.” Peter sighed but nodded, knowing he wasn’t going to get anything out of Tony even if he tried.

The rest of the tour guide consisted of viewing Tony’s private office, meeting other Avengers and visiting superheroes, and talking with different technical experts. It was when Thor showed up at the end of the tour that made the crowd buzz.

“Thor? I thought you were taking care of a project in Texas,” Tony said, confused.

Thor chuckled. “I got back a few minutes ago when Natasha told me Midtown Tech was visiting.” He nodded his head at Peter, who laughed nervously.

“Hi Thor!” you heard a girl from your group yell out.

You and Peter simultaneously rolled your eyes and shared a quiet laugh.

“I was thinking you all could try to lift this old thing,” he said while holding up Mjolnir. “I doubt any of you could lift it but it’ll be funny to see you try.”

“That sounds entertaining,” Tony said casually before looking at Mr. Harrington for permission, to which your teacher nodded out of both confusion and in awe.

“I’ll set it down here,” Thor said, putting Mjolnir in the middle of an unoccupied furnished room. “So, who wants to try first?” Almost half of the class ran up to be first in line and made a makeshift queue.

“You gonna try?” you asked Peter, leaning over to whisper.

He shrugged. “I’ll probably give it a go,” he said, knowing he had already tried to pick up Mjolnir up several times. “You?”

“Oh, definitely,” you replied. “I know that nothing’s going to happen but I really want to say I lifted the hammer at least once in my lifetime.”

“Peter! Watch me lift it!” Ned shouted to grab Peter’s attention. Peter laughed and watched as Ned struggled to lift the hammer and heaved a heavy sigh when he was unable to.

“Damn,” said Ned. He shook his head in feigned disappointment. “Peter, you should try!”

Peter only laughed, knowing he wouldn’t be able to pick it up. Thor patted Peter on the back and watched as another student failed to lift the hammer.

“Good try,” Thor commented. “Who’s next?”

“Y/N!” Ned said in excitement.

You took a deep breath and felt that your palms were suddenly sweating, but shook the confusion out of your head and blamed your nervousness on the thirty odd pairs of eyes watching you at once.

But when your hands went to grip the black handles of the sacred hammer, your palms tingled and you felt a burning sensation against your skin and abruptly let go of it with a startled gasp. The room flickered as the room shook slightly before the power turned out, leaving a state of panic within the students in the room.

“F.R.I.D.A.Y, turn the lights back on,” said Tony.

“Working on turning the backup generator as we speak,” she replied. The students in the room collectively gasped at the seemingly unknown voice echoing through the room. “I should warn you that the entire building has lost power.”

“That’s why it’s taking so long,” Tony cursed. “Thor, get your hammer off the ground.”

“M-My hands,” you stuttered, looking down to see that the sun from outside was shining through the clear glass, showcasing tour singed hands that were slightly pink yet felt like it was to the point of burning.

“Mr. Stark, it’s Y/N!” Peter shouted, looking at your still body while the other students were running and screaming in havoc.

Tony’s ears perked up and he looked to you standing in the middle of the room, looking down at your hands with a confused expression written all over your face.

“Y/N,” Tony said, worried as he rushed to your side. “Natasha, get everyone out of the building! Pete, come with me.”

Tony brought you to another room where it was quieter. The backup generator seemed to be working because the lights turned on when Tony flipped the switch. He saw your hands turning a shade of red and wasted no time to grab two ice packs and wrap them in paper towels, preparing to bandage them to your palms.

You, on the other hand, felt like you had lightning coursing through your entire body. It felt like of electricity were pulsing inside of you and bursts of fire were looking at your palms, which the ice packs were help subduing.

“T-Tony,” you sniffles as he taped your bandage in place. “I don’t know what’s going on.”

“Peter, I need you to grab some sanitizing wipes,” Tony instructed.

“On it,” Peter said without thinking and opened a drawer and handed Tony the wipes. The meticulous man standing in front of you sat you down on one of the medical tables and stood in front of you, cleaning the small amount of blood that had seeped from your palms.

You shut your eyes at the burning sensation internally and the stinging sensation of the sanitizing wipes Tony used on your hands. But you attention was turned from your pain to how Peter knew where the wipes were.

“Peter?” you asked, confused. “Why are you here?”

“I asked him to be here,” Tony said. “I thought you’d want to see a familiar face.” He opted not to tell you about his identity as Spider-Man but had an itch that you were about find out.

“What’s going on?”

“I…I,” Tony stammered. “You need to see something.” 

Wordlessly, Tony pulled up a device that projected a file docket with the headline ‘Y/N Stark,’ reading the information underneath it. You saw that your blood sample had been tested against Tony’s a few days after you have given a few samples of your blood and it was a positive match when tested against his DNA. 

“Oh my God,” you whispered to yourself, looking between the projected image and Tony. Peter stood in the background, just as confused as you. “I don’t understand.”

“I’m your father, Y/N. I’ve known this for a couple of weeks now,” he explained calmly, not looking you in the eye. 

The room was silent. You could hear the heavy breaths of Peter and Tony, and you could feel their eyes staring at you while they awaited your reaction and what you were going to say next. 

“What?” you asked yourself in a quiet whisper. The more you stared at the docket, the more you couldn’t believe that the man you had been searching for had been right under your nose the entire time, consoling you about your feelings about your lost father. 

“Y/N,” he started. “Please say something.” 

“Why didn’t you tell me?” you asked with a snap, looking him in the eye as you spoke before looking back to your bandaged hands. 

“I’I couldn’t find the strength,” Tony said. “You were standing right in front of me and I didn’t know how to break the news to you.”

“But you sat there!” you exclaimed with hot tears on the tip of your nose. You could feel yourself needing to take a breather but the last thing on your mind was relaxing. “You sat there and told me I’d find my father when you knew you were him. You lied to me”

“No, I-I didn’t,” Tony replied. 

“You did, Tony!” 

He gulped and took a deep breath before holding you in between his arms, his hands on either side of your arms. 

“I’ve been searching for you for seventeen years. I’ve done everything I could to look for your mother and it’s been a dead end search until the day you gave me your DNA sample.” Tony looked at you with desperation. “I found you, Y/N. After seventeen years of looking for you I finally found you.”

You took a deep breath as Tony pleaded with you to forgive him for not saying anything because after seventeen years, he hadn’t gathered the words or the courage to tell you he was your father. All the times you had visited his tower was a chance for him to come clean and yet he could never physically get himself to speak whenever you were around. 

“Dad?” you asked tentatively, your voice cracking and your eyes watering more than they were. 

“It’s me, Y/N. It’s always been me.” 

Despite your aching body and hands, you gathered the strength to put your arms around Tony’s shoulder and leaned into him where you put all your weight and trust into the man who you had idolized since you were a young girl. The man who you had wished was your father when you were younger was actually your father and you didn’t have to worry about looking for him anymore. 

“I-I can’t imagine what you went through,” you said to Tony after he had pulled away. “Seventeen years of your life was spent looking.”

“It was worth it,” he admitted. “It was worth getting to see the smile on your face when you first walked in here. It was worth telling you today because you don’t hate me.”

You laughed at his attempt to make a lighthearted joke in a heavy situation, something that your mother had always accused you of doing. 

“My mom,” you said. “She’s always telling me that my father was a lowlife, sometimes that he was a druggie, or that he was someone who never cared about me but she was wrong.” You let out a cry and Tony rushed to hug you once more. 

Feeling perplexed at the woman who had loved him and then left without a note, Tony’s initial feeling in his gut was to tell you to leave your mother and stay with him in the tower where things were safe. You didn’t have to worry about unresolved feelings and you two could get to know each other without interruption. 

But all his feelings dissolved when he took one look at your face. His thoughts weren’t in his own interests anymore, but in yours. With a change of heart (a reluctant one), he let his hand move loose strands from your face. 

“Talk to her,” he urged. “Tell her you know I’m your father. Ask her why she did what she did and maybe you can find it in your heart to forgive her.”

“I can’t,” you whispered. 

“You can.” Tony held your hands in his carefully and nodded at you. “You deserve the truth, not another mystery after you’ve solved one already.”

For the sake of your new relationship with Tony, you agreed. 

“And now for the elephant in the room,” you said bitterly. “Peter.”

Your head whipped to the boy who was standing in the sidelines and Tony looked between you two, deciding it was better to leave you alone. He stroked your cheek and told you he’d be outside, cleaning up the mess that had ensued until you were ready to go home. 

“How could you?” you asked him once Tony had left the room. “You manipulated me, Peter. You made me believe that you hated me while kissing me as Spider-Man. Then you made me feel guilty and confused once you decided to be nice to me as Peter Parker.” 

“Y/N, I-”

“You told me you liked me as Spider-Man but ran away from me as Peter Parker. We kissed in my bedroom, Peter! Y-You made me think that we were friends when we aren’t.”

“No, Y/N, you don’t mean that.”

“I don’t know what to think,” you said, shaking your head is disbelief. You stood up from the medical bed and winced at the sudden movement, suddenly feeling the electric jolts in your body again. “I just need time.”

“Y/N, please,” Peter pleaded. 

“Please,” you snapped, annoyed at Peter and at your body acting up again. “I need time to think and process what I just learned. You’re Spider-Man, for crying out loud!”

“And I wanted to tell you but I didn’t know how, considering you hated Peter Parker,” he retorted. 

“Because all you did was ignore me, Peter. From the minute I stepped foot into Midtown until Ned asked me to hang out with you guys.”

“Y/N…,” he pleaded. You walked out the door and Peter watched as your figure left. He sighed and watched as Tony ran after you without giving him a spare glance. Peter rubbed his face in his hands, not knowing whether or not you two would ever be on speaking terms again. 

“What happened?” Peter asked Tony when he went outside. There, Tony and Thor had been talking feverishly when Peter walked in. 

“It’s her,” Thor said. 

“What do you mean?”

“The half human, half Asgardian,” Thor explained. “About seventeen years ago, my father exiled a woman for creating a child that was half human and half Asgardian in fear that the child would one day rise up and try to destroy Asgard. We’ve just found the child.”

“What, Y/N? There’s no way,” Peter begun, not convincing himself. 

“She’s the Light Bringer,” said Thor. “She kept the peace in the Asgardian council and, to you humans, was the person who brought fire to Earth. That’s why we call her Light Bringer.”

“Y/N’s an Asgardian?”

“As far as I know, yes,” Thor said in all seriousness. 

Tony rubbed his chin and sighed heavily, not knowing what to make of the situation that had unfolded in front of him. Thor, having found someone that he had been close to twenty years ago, was over the moon. 

All Peter knew was that his spidey senses had finally stopped.

***

Your apartment smelled like oregano when you entered.

It was almost five in the afternoon and your mother was standing in the kitchen, stirring a pot when she turned around and glanced over her shoulder to see you. 

“How was your field trip?” she asked. She stopped stirring when she saw your hands. “My goodness, Y/N. What happened?”

“Why didn’t you tell me Tony Stark is my father?” you asked. 

“Y/N,” she began. “It was for your own protection.”

“You lied to me!” you shouted, causing your mother to cease her actions and turn the stove off to prevent the food from burning. “Of all the times I’ve asked about my dad, you lied each time I asked.” 

“To protect you,” your mother reiterated. “I lied for your safety.” 

You were silent. 

“And for him.”

Confused, you sighed and sat down, letting your head rest in between your arms before taking the bandages off. 

“I touched Thor’s hammer today,” you began. “I touched the hammer and then my hands burned, and the next thing I know, Tony Stark’s telling me he’s my dad.” 

Your mother’s head whipped. 

“You touched what?”

You shot her an annoyed expression. “Mjolnir. Thor’s weapon?” 

Your mother sighed. “Y/N, there’s something I need to tell you. Wait right here.” 

You watched as your mother disappeared around the corner and waited for an explanation as you tapped your leg. She was gone all for a minute before coming back with a long necklace and a pendant attached at the end, sliding it to where you sat before taking a seat at the corner next to you.

“My mother gave this to me as a present when I was born,” she began. “It’s a gift that’s been passed down from generation to generation and I was going to give it to you when you were born. But as you know, your father was never present in your life and it’s because I left him.”

“Why would you do that?” you asked her. Your mother pursed her lips as she heaved a heavy sigh and closed her eyes. She opened them to see you staring at her with a blank expression. 

“I’m not from Portland, Y/N. This pendant,” she said, holding up the necklace, “is supposed to protect the owner of the necklace. It lets Asgardians find you whenever and wherever you need help.”

“A-Asgardians?”

She nodded. “I came here twenty years ago and met your father, Tony, at one of his charity events. I was sent to Midgard, Earth, by Odin to check in on one of the planets he had been keeping tabs on. I was supposed to be here for six months before returning but I met Tony before I was supposed to leave.

“I spent a good two years with him, traveling back and forth from Earth to Asgard. I told Tony it was business trips and Odin that I was keeping a close eye on Earth like he had asked me to do. Only, he found out that I was pregnant with you and exiled me from Asgard and swore to eliminate the half human and half Asgardian.” 

You eyes widened at her confessions and waited for her to speak again. 

“This pendant would’ve activated your powers,” she said. “I got rid of anything from Asagrd because it would’ve activated your powers and sent Odin on a path that would lead him to you.

“Y/N,” she began, “the day I found out I was pregnant with you was the happiest day of my life and having to leave Tony was the worst. I didn’t tell you because your life would’ve been in actual danger and now that Valkyrie’s leading Asgard, I don’t think I have to worry about that anymore.”

“Why did you keep this from me if you knew I wasn’t in danger anymore?”

“I-I didn’t know if I still had to look over my shoulder,” your mother said. “I spent a long time worrying about our lives and yes, twenty years is a blink of an eye to Asgardians, but not when you’re protecting someone you love.”

You sat for a moment in silence and she waited for you to speak. 

“I don’t appreciate the lies,” you said. “But, I appreciate you protecting me, mom. I know you do so much for me that I don’t know and I love you so much. I’ll always love you.” 

You stood up and walked to where she was sitting and wrapped your arms around her in a forgiving hug, letting her know that all the secrets she had been harboring wasn’t something you were going to hold against her.

“Thank you,” she whispered as you pulled away. She wiped some tears from her cheeks and chuckled. “I’m such a mess, aren’t I?”

“C’mom, mom. You say that as if I’m not. Hey, does this mean you’re going to outlive me?”

She chuckled. “Let’s not think about that right now. By the way, if we’re laying out secrets in the table, there’s something else I think you should know.”

“Oh?” you asked with a raised eyebrow. “What’s that?”

“I’ve been seeing someone for the past few weeks,” she admitted. “We were just friends for a while but we’re testing the waters right now. I-I really want you to meet her.”

You watched as your mother tried to suppress a smile but failed when she imagined the thought of two people she loved meeting for the first time.

“And what’s mystery woman’s name?” you teased.

“Alice,” she replied. “I don’t know when or where yet but I wanted you to know about her.”

“I guess I should tell you about Peter,” you said, sighing.

“The boy who doesn’t like you?”

“Well, he didn’t like me but now I think he does? Anyway, you’re Asgardian and since that’s something I don’t think you want people finding out, I don’t think you’ll tell anyone what I’m about to tell you.” She gestured for you to continue. “Peter’s Spider-Man and we kind of have a thing.”

“Is that why you’ve been so happy lately?” she asked with a quirked eyebrow.

“Yeah,” you said with a blush. “But that’s the thing. We confessed our feelings to each other but I confessed it to Spider-Man, only to realize it was Peter.”

“And why is that such a bad thing?”

“Because Peter made me feel like he didn’t like me when he was Peter Parker but made me feel like the luckiest girl on Earth as Spider-Man.” Your mother thought for a moment before speaking.

“I think this is something you should ask Tony,” she advised. “I can give you all the boy drama advice you want but this is something so specific that only Tony can answer.”

“Is that a good idea?”

She shrugged. “Hell if I know. But he probably knows more than I do and it’ll give him a chance to bond with you.”

“You’re not mad?” you asked. “Or even slightly concerned that I want to get to know Tony?”

She shook her head. “I still love him, Y/N. I do. Not in the way I did twenty years ago, but I still care for him and he deserves to know the daughter he looked for for over seventeen years. I owe him at least that.”

“Okay,” you breathed. “But Peter is like, his protege. Plus, I don’t know if I’m ready to trust Peter again.”

“You don’t have to be ready,” she said. “Nothing’s going to fix itself unless you do something about it. You clearly have feelings for this Peter person, so what better way to clear the air than get advice from someone who knows him?”

“You’re right,” you said with a grin. “Thanks, mom.”

“I love you, honey.”

“I love you too.” You began walking out of the kitchen but popped your head back in. 

“So does that mean you know Loki and Thor?”

***
